This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems with the story, however, only stem from the fact that it ended too quickly, not that there is any fault in with what was present. An excellent film continues the tradition of dark, gritty South African films based on the realities of living in a prejudiced society.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, whom her son has accidentally manifested, wants nothing more than to meet its own mother. Well, turns out, that she and her son should not have come here, and the only way to solve the problem, but beside a line of bloodshed, is to destroy the cat, of course.
